Bittensor Subnet 44 Validator Hotfix Update

Weâ€™ve released a new validator update to improve stability and fairness across the network. If you're running a validator, make sure to update as soon as possible.

Hereâ€™s whatâ€™s changing ğŸ”½

âœ… Max Processing Time Capped at 15s
- Slow hotkeys (e.g. 200s) were skewing speed score normalization
- Any response >15s now gets a speed score of 0
- Speed score normalization now uses the lesser of 15s or the observed max

âœ… Unresponsive Hotkeys Penalized
- Previously, some hotkeys stayed active despite being unresponsive for up to 72h
- Now, a timeout = empty response = score penalty

These changes improve the fairness of the scoring system and ensure that only responsive, efficient validators are rewarded. $TAO

Score is expanding rapidly and weâ€™re happy to welcome Sam (@sirubi_eth) as our new Content Writer!

With a deep curiosity sparked by Bitcoin and the 2017 ICO boom, Sam has spent the past decade exploring how blockchain can reshape finance, data, and systems of power. He has worked across various Web3 projects, writing on everything from decentralised finance and money to interoperability and tokenised real-world assets. With a solid grasp of financial systems, macroeconomics, and their intersection with crypto, Sam has a knack for breaking down complex ideas and uncovering their broader societal implications, translating them into clear, accessible narratives for a broad audience.

Combining deep Web3 expertise, sharp storytelling, and a lifelong passion for football, Sam is a natural fit to help shape Scoreâ€™s voice. He connected immediately with the mission to democratise elite sports data and now plays a key role in articulating Scoreâ€™s broader vision: building the decentralised computer vision layer for AI, starting with football and expanding far beyond the pitch.

A word from Sam:
 â€œIâ€™ve come to believe that decentralisation is key to increasing access, enabling scale, and democratising critical systems, whether itâ€™s money, finance, or intelligence. Thatâ€™s what drew me to Score. As a football fan, Iâ€™ve seen how data is transforming the sport, yet access remains locked behind paywalls and elite infrastructure. Score changes that. By decentralising computer vision, it puts powerful tools in the hands of every club, making the game more open, competitive, and dynamic.
But the vision goes far beyond football. Score is building foundational infrastructure to unlock visual intelligence across sports, industries, and entirely new domains. Iâ€™m proud to be part of a team thatâ€™s not just building cutting-edge technology, but doing it in a way that empowers more people to participate, compete, and innovate.â€

Score is excited to welcome Kacper as our new Social Media Manager!

Kacper brings over four years of hands-on experience in Web3, crypto, e-commerce, and AI, working with early-stage startups, high-growth ventures, and established tech teams. Throughout his career, heâ€™s led the growth of social media accounts from 0 to 200k+ followers and managed communities of over 100k members, driving engagement and building loyal user bases across fast-moving, digital-native ecosystems.

From growing his own Web3 projects to helping startups and established projects scale in the crypto and AI space, Kacper witnessed firsthand how attention, trust, and clarity make or break a project. This experience makes him a powerful addition to the Score team as we level up our social and community efforts and bridge the worlds of football, data, and decentralised tech.

A word from Kacper:
"Web3 and AI are full of bold ideas - but not all of them solve real problems.

After years of working in this space, you learn to see past the hype. Score Vision isnâ€™t another dashboard with fancy numbers. Itâ€™s a decentralised computer vision framework that tackles one of footballâ€™s biggest bottlenecks: access to high-quality analytics.

Football is a global game, but access to advanced analytics has been limited to the top clubs. Score fixes that. This isnâ€™t just a better tool - itâ€™s a paradigm shift. Score allows every club, scout, and analyst to see the game deeper, faster, and smarter.

Thatâ€™s the kind of change I want to be part of."

Winning Metrics: How xG is calculated âš½ï¸

This stat is everywhere in modern football, from post-match debates to scouting reports - but what goes into the numbers?

Letâ€™s break down the key factors behind this game-changing metric. â¬‡ï¸

[1/6] ğŸ§µ

For instance, penalties have an average xG of around 0.8 because theyâ€™re very likely to be scored.

Theyâ€™re taken from close range with no defenders, making them one of the easiest and most reliable ways to score, around 4 out of every 5 go in.

xG models consider a wide range of inputs to assess the quality of a chance, including:

- Distance to goal
- Angle the shot is taken from
- Type of shot (foot, header)
- Goalkeeperâ€™s position
- Number and position of defenders
- Context of play (open play, set-piece)

Want to understand xG in even more detail?

Read the full article here:

Introducing Winning Metrics - Edition #01: xG

xG, xG, xG, you hear it everywhere, but what is itâ“ï¸

How is it calculated? Is it reliable? What are its limitations?

Find out in the first edition of our new series ğŸ”½

xG allows scouts and analysts to evaluate players more accurately. It shows which players can score from low xG chances, and which ones regularly waste big opportunities with high xG.

The numbers tell a deeper story than goals alone.

Statistical models analyze various factors by comparing each shot to thousands of similar situations found in historical data.

The result is a probability score, an xG value, which ranges from 0 to 1. This score indicates how likely it was for the shot to result in a goal.

We're excited to announce that @dsvfund has invested $100K OTC into @webuildscore, forming a strategic partnership between two entities aligned on $TAO's long-term vision and ethos.

Score is building real-time video intelligence on Bittensor through Subnet 44, creating Vision-as-a-Service that transforms raw video into actionable insights. As Subnet 44 opens up to other verticals, it provides the infrastructure layer to become the optic nerve for AI, supporting the development of human-level AI and beyond.

"Siam and Mark bring exactly the kind of strategic thinking we need as we scale Score," said Nigel Grant  co-founder and Score's CSO. "They understand the Bittensor ecosystem deeply and share our long-term vision for what decentralized AI can achieve. This partnership gives us the strategic support to navigate the complexities of building on $TAO while staying focused on our mission."

This represents a bridge between aligned entities committed to the long-term, positive-sum game that $TAO's core values represent.

Looking ahead, Score is expanding beyond Subnet 44 as we train our Object Value Function model across other subnets and prepare to introduce new tasks to our miners pool. 

This growth reflects our commitment to building infrastructure that serves the entire Bittensor ecosystem.
